definition: to fade out (cinema)/to withdraw from (politics, acting etc)/to fade from (memory)
insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Is there a built in way to fade between layers?
sentences.chinese: 有没有层间淡入淡出的内部方法？

sentences.english: The fadeout follows closely the pattern of the solar flare, being observed at the same time as the flare.
sentences.chinese: 淡出严密仿效日晕的形式，被观察在火光的同时。

sentences.english: I would like the photos to fade-in from black.
sentences.chinese: 我想淡出来自黑人的照片。

sentences.english: If the environment changes, they must die out.
sentences.chinese: 如果环境变了，他们必须淡出。

sentences.english: The fade turn is the most professional modeling turn for runway walking.
sentences.chinese: 淡入淡出的又是最专业的跑道造型转走。

sentences.english: Into the Yuan and Ming, indigo print gradually fading out people's lives.
sentences.chinese: 进入元明后，夹缬渐渐淡出人们的生活。

sentences.english: The fade blink speed on collision.
If the fadeout isn't done correctly you can also get a bad glue job too.
sentences.chinese: 如果淡出没有正确地完成您能也得到坏也是胶合工作。

sentences.english: Later in Qing dynasty, the i-hsueh schools literally phased out the history of education in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 清末，义学逐渐淡出中国古代教育的历史。

sentences.english: Standard & Poor's announced that Deven Sharma was stepping down as its president.
sentences.chinese: 标普宣告他们的副总裁戴文萨马正在淡出。

sentences.english: Already ten years has passed since my retirement and drift apart from society.
sentences.chinese: 退离工作岗位，淡出社会生活，倏忽十有余年。

sentences.english: Sense" is made with digital print and fade-out color so to make it chic."
sentences.chinese: 采用数码打印及淡出的颜色，增添服装的时尚感。

sentences.english: Gradually fade out the Elife let you, a person lead.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐让迩淡出涐的生活，一个人过。

sentences.english: In a slide show, the images appear in a timed sequence, with images fading in and out.
sentences.chinese: 在幻灯片浏览中，图像按照时间顺序先后淡入淡出。

sentences.english: After the 1980 election, Charles and David Koch receded from the public arena.
sentences.chinese: 1980年大选之后，查理斯和戴维淡出了公众视线。

definition: to retire (from society, esp. from politics)/to vanish
to be forgotten/to fade from memory
nowadays/now
gradually
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
to withdraw/to abort/to quit/to log out (computing)
field of view/horizon
tremendously popular for a while
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
to withdraw to the second line of duty/to resign from a leading post (and assume an advisory post)
to hit the big time
long ago/for a long time
show business
to assist one's husband and educate the children (idiom)/the traditional roles of a good wife
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
